channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Personal wheelie bins to block parking on his road, 28th January
item.description:
The gentleman who owns 47 Carisbrooke avenue is using his personal wheelie bins to block parking on his road. This has been happening daily for the past month. This is unacceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Cotleigh Avenue, Albany Park, Greater London

item.title: Clothes and rubbish dumped, 28th January
item.description:
On footpath and in shrubbery between Spindle close and Ruston Road. Fly tipping hot-spot. More clothes and household rubbish dumped. Please can we have signage and cctv Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Spindle Close, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside nursery and gym, 28th January
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally report 3 blocked street drains located outside our business premises Regents Plaza. The blockage is causing water to overflow and leak down our car park walls, resulting in water ingress into our car park. This issue is now causing substantial damage to our property, and if left unresolved, there is a serious risk of further deterioration and associated costs. We consider this matter urgent and request that a representative attend the site as soon as possible to assess and rectify the problem. Please treat this as a priority to prevent further damage. I would appreciate confirmation of when this issue will be addressed. Yours Sincerely Ian Esguerra Building Manager Regents Plaza 07956 711 740 Ianodesign@yahoo.co.uk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kilburn High Road, Kilburn, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass everywhere in the copse., 28th January
item.description:
Please use what3words for precise postitioning of the rubbish.- same.swear.cube. In the middle of the copse and scattered amongst all the trees there is a lot of broken brown and green glass. Some of the necks of the bottle are lying broken on the ground, some of the glass has been broken up into smaller pieces. There are clear plastic cups, beer cans, food containers, paper, plastic bags all in the same area. It is an area that is beginning to be used by a few individuals as a daytime meeting place.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chemical Oil Drums, 28th January
item.description:
For the last month a restaurant has been dumping bags of rotting meat and oil cans and chemical containers in our garbage cans across the street from my place. These cans were empty yesterday and now they’re filled with refuse that’s bringing rats, can they be dumped, please and can you figure out who’s doing this?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Bridge Road, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dirty block - warburton house, 28th January
item.description:
The Warburton blocks have not been cleaned for over 2 months or more. Having someone sweep while the dirty smelly piss stains are still there makes no sense. I have email many times and haven't got a response. So hopefully this will work.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): London Fields East Side, Hackney, London

item.title: Pavement blocked with builders materials and waste, 28th January
item.description:
The pavement is completly blocked with builders materials and has loads of mud and is slippery to. The blockage is forcing me to drive my mobilty scooter in the road to get past. I use this route every day. And I nearly got hit by a car today as a van was blocking my veiw. Other residents are having the same problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellan Close, Blackfen, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish and branches from trees, 28th January
item.description:
Moorfield road and chislehurst road where the bench is are filthy. Rubbish every and I’m constantly having to go out and pick up peoples little. There are large brunches and debris from the trees all over the road and generally not well keeper. This road is constantly dirty and untidy. There are no bins for litter or dog waste that is always left around. Not good enough!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorfield Road, Goddington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): East Bay Lane, Hackney, London

item.title: Fly tipping, 28th January
item.description:
This as been here a week, hence nobody's been to empty bins as dogs poo bags on top, rubbish fly tipped was tidy, but as nobody seems to clean thus park, BUTTS WOOD, fox, squirrels etc have ripped things open, making it worse. No picker been In again, as bottle dumped by bench bern there 7 days!! Its a constant battle i know, the family who dump their junk by thus bin are pain in backside, but unless you put in CCTV, they will continue. Whats happened? Used to be a picker least once a week, LEAST, guy before was excellent he picked hutchins rd, and did whole of Butt's wood, nit just the main path way as done now but the van that drives in *when it comes i should say* Other parks are way better attended, why nit this one ? Please can we get a,regular picker, not just hutchins rd where student dump stuff daily, but the walk way by school that leads into Butt's wood, where students dump( at the moment dirty tissues) picker tends to not go left and pick, but goes right towards school entrance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Butts Wood Path, Thamesmead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
